definition: insect that eats into wood, books, clothes etc/fig. vermin
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: Decoration, the Xiaodongdong have found the floor borers .
sentences.chinese: 装修后，发现地板上的小洞洞有蛀虫。

sentences.english: A marble - sized ball, originally of camphor but now of naphthalene, stored with clothes to repel moths.
sentences.chinese: 用来使蛀虫远离储存的衣服的樟脑或萘的小圆球。

sentences.english: The cut worm forgives the plow.
sentences.chinese: 被犁断的蛀虫原谅犁头。

sentences.english: What sort of moths eat chainmail?
Wood says dirty clothes are magnets for moths.
sentences.chinese: Wood说，脏衣服是滋生蛀虫的温床。

sentences.english: Upper night will hear a plank of wood borers in defoliation , and the sawdust on homeopathy.
sentences.chinese: 晚上会听见上铺有蛀虫在啃食木板，木屑就顺势而下。

sentences.english: You need to treat this wood for woodworm.
sentences.chinese: 你需要对这种木头进行处理以防蛀虫。

sentences.english: Woodworm had eaten away at the door frame.
sentences.chinese: 木蛀虫将门框一点点蛀坏了。

sentences.english: Woodworm had eaten into most of the furniture.
sentences.chinese: 木蛀虫把大部份家具都蛀了。

sentences.english: It is resistant to decay but not to marine borers.
sentences.chinese: 它抗腐烂，但是不抗海洋蛀虫。

sentences.english: Moth bean coffee by the infringement insects.
sentences.chinese: 蛀虫豆受虫侵害的咖啡豆。

sentences.english: Your wealth has rotted away, your clothes have become moth-eaten.
sentences.chinese: 你们的财产腐烂了，你们的衣服被蛀虫吃了。

definition: grasping officials, corrupt mandarins (idiom); abuse and corruption
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
lit. the fat and wealth of the people (idiom); the nation's hard-won wealth (esp. as an object of unscrupulous exploitation)/the people's blood, sweat and tears
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
